events.originalText: Gunmen attacked Istanbul's Atatürk Airport, killing 45 people and injuring more than 230 others.
events.subtitle: 2016 Atatürk Airport attack
events.headline: Gunmen attack Istanbul's Atatürk Airport, killing 45

events.originalText: Paperback Software, a company founded by Adam Osborne, was found guilty of copyright infringement for using Lotus 1-2-3's look-and-feel interface in its own spreadsheet program.
events.subtitle: Paperback Software
events.headline: Paperback Software guilty of copyright infringement

events.originalText: President Slobodan Milošević gave a speech in which he described the possibility of "armed battles" in the future of Serbia's national development.
events.subtitle: Slobodan Milošević
events.headline: President Milošević warns of 'armed battles' in Serbia

events.originalText: In Regents of the University of California v. Bakke, the U.S. Supreme Court barred quota systems in college admissions but held that affirmative-action programs advantaging minorities were constitutional.
events.subtitle: Regents of the University of California v. Bakke
events.headline: U.S. Supreme Court rules on college admissions

events.originalText: In response to a police raid at the Stonewall Inn in New York City, groups of gay and transgender people began to riot, a watershed event for the worldwide gay rights movement.
events.subtitle: Stonewall Inn
events.headline: Stonewall Inn raid sparks gay rights movement

events.originalText: Polish workers demanding better working conditions began massive protests in Poznań, but were later violently repressed by the Polish People's Army and the Internal Security Corps.
events.subtitle: 1956 Poznań protests
events.headline: Polish workers protest for better conditions in Poznań

events.originalText: Korean War: South Korean forces began the Bodo League massacre, summarily executing tens of thousands of suspected North Korean sympathizers.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: South Korean forces begin Bodo League massacre

events.originalText: World War II: The Wehrmacht launched Case Blue, a strategic German offensive to capture oil fields in the south of the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Wehrmacht launches Case Blue offensive in Soviet Union

events.originalText: First World War: Around 55,000 workers in Berlin went on strike to protest against the trial of anti-war campaigner Karl Liebknecht.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Berlin workers strike against anti-war trial

events.originalText: Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife, Sophie, Duchess of Hohenberg, were assassinated by a Yugoslav nationalist named Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo, sparking the outbreak of World War I.
events.subtitle: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria
events.headline: Archduke Franz Ferdinand assassinated in Sarajevo

events.originalText: The Nakhla meteorite (fragments pictured), the first meteorite to suggest signs of aqueous processes on Mars, fell to Earth in Abu Hummus, Egypt.
events.subtitle: Nakhla meteorite
events.headline: Nakhla meteorite suggests aqueous processes on Mars

events.originalText: In the worst maritime disaster involving a Danish merchant ship, SS Norge ran aground on Hasselwood Rock and sank in the North Atlantic, resulting in more than 635 deaths.
events.subtitle: SS Norge
events.headline: SS Norge sinks in North Atlantic, over 635 deaths

events.originalText: The U.S. Court of Private Land Claims ruled that James Reavis's claim to 18,600 sq mi (48,000 km2) of land in present-day Arizona and New Mexico was "wholly fictitious and fraudulent".
events.subtitle: United States Court of Private Land Claims
events.headline: Court rules James Reavis's land claim fraudulent

events.originalText: Belgian musician Adolphe Sax patented his design of the saxophone (example pictured).
events.subtitle: Adolphe Sax
events.headline: Adolphe Sax patents design of the saxophone

events.originalText: Giselle (title role pictured), a ballet by the French composer Adolphe Adam, was first performed at the Théâtre de l'Académie Royale de Musique in Paris.
events.subtitle: Giselle
events.headline: Ballet 'Giselle' first performed in Paris

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The militia of the Province of South Carolina repelled a British attack on Charleston.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Province of South Carolina militia repels British attack

events.originalText: Edward IV was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey.
events.subtitle: Edward IV of England
events.headline: Edward IV crowned King of England

events.originalText: Alboin, the king of the Lombards, was assassinated in Verona in a coup d'état instigated by the Byzantines.
events.subtitle: Alboin
events.headline: King Alboin of the Lombards assassinated in Verona
